articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel pounded Rafah with airstrikes and tank fire on Tuesday, pressing its offensive in Gaza's southern city despite international condemnation of an attack that sparked a blaze in a tent camp for the displaced, killing at least 45 people.
articles.title: Israeli forces press Rafah offensive despite global outcry

articles.author: Lewis Jackson, Renju Jose
articles.description: Thousands of residents were ordered to evacuate from the path of a still-active landslide in Papua New Guinea by the government on Tuesday, after parts of a mountain collapsed, burying an initial estimate of more than 2,000 people.
articles.title: Papua New Guinea orders thousands to evacuate from path of 'active' landslide

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spain, Ireland and Norway will officially recognise a Palestinian state on Tuesday, despite an angry reaction from Israel, which has found itself increasingly isolated after seven months of conflict in Gaza.
articles.title: Spain, Ireland, Norway set to recognise Palestinian statehood

articles.author: Ju-Min Park, Josh Smith
articles.description: North Korea's latest satellite launch exploded in a fireball before dropping into the Yellow Sea just minutes after lifting off, but analysts say the attempt showcased new strides in the nuclear-armed country's race for space.
articles.title: North Korea says it tried new fuel in satellite launch that ended in fiery explosion

articles.author: Nellie Peyton, Alexander Winning
articles.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa, who has staked his reputation on cleaning up the image of the ruling African National Congress, will lead the party toward its biggest test of the democratic era when South Africans vote on Wednesday.
articles.title: South Africa's Ramaphosa steers ANC into potentially pivotal election

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Moira Warburton
articles.description: The Biden administration told Israel to take every precaution to protect civilians after a military strike in Rafah killed dozens of Palestinians, as it faced calls from some fellow Democrats to halt military shipments to Israel.
articles.title: Biden tells Israel to protect civilians after Rafah strike

articles.author: James Pomfret, Jessie Pang
articles.description: Hong Kong's national security police arrested six people across the city on Tuesday under a new national security law known as Article 23 for alleged seditious intent, according to a statement.
articles.title: Hong Kong arrests six for sedition under new security law

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Fabian Hamacher, Angie Teo
articles.description: Thousands of people protested outside Taiwan's parliament on Tuesday after it passed a reform package to increase oversight of the government pushed by the opposition but opposed by the ruling party, which did not have the numbers to block it.
articles.title: Thousands protest as Taiwan's parliament passes contested reforms

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: Sergii Polituchyi arrived at his burning printing house before the firefighters, and the agony and destruction caused by the mid-morning Russian missile attack is seared into his mind.
articles.title: Ukrainian publisher mourns human toll of Russian attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Dutch intelligence chief Dick Schoof will be presented on Tuesday as the proposed prime minister of the Netherlands' incoming rightwing government.
articles.title: Dutch parties to propose former intelligence chief as new prime minister
